articles.title: PYPL, DJT, MU And More: 5 Stocks Investors Couldn't Stop Buzzing About This Week
articles.mainIdea: PYPL, DJT, MU And More: 5 Stocks Investors Couldn't Stop Buzzing About This Week
articles.summary: Benzinga: PYPL, DJT, MU And More: 5 Stocks Investors Couldn't Stop Buzzing About This Week. Retail investors talked up five hot stocks this week (Dec. 15 to Dec. 19) on X and Reddit's r/WallStreetBets, driven by earnings, retail hype, AI buzz, and corporate news flow. The stocks, PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL), Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ:DJT), Micron Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:MU), Rivian Automotive Inc. (NASDAQ:RIVN), and Nike Inc. (NYSE:NKE), spanning finance, crypto, semiconductors, AI, automotive, and sports, reflected diverse retail interests. Don't Miss: If the Related tickers mentioned: MU, NKE, RIVN.

articles.title: This Week In Digital Payment - Euronet Wins Mastercard Award for Agile Credit Innovation
articles.mainIdea: This Week In Digital Payment - Euronet Wins Mastercard Award for Agile Credit Innovation
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: This Week In Digital Payment - Euronet Wins Mastercard Award for Agile Credit Innovation. Euronet Worldwide has been recognized with Mastercard's Excellence in Agility award for its innovative approach to credit issuance. This accolade highlights the impact of Euronet's acquisition of CoreCard, which facilitated swift deployment of Mastercard credit programs, significantly enhancing the company's issuing capabilities. The award was granted for Euronet's rapid commercial credit program development, including features like advanced loyalty models and digital wallet provisioning,... Related tickers mentioned: CCRD, EEFT, MA, SOFI, V.

articles.title: Weekly Stock List
articles.summary: Argus Research: Weekly Stock List. Third-quarter earnings season is over, and a hefty number of companies across sectors raised guidance. In fact, so many took that action that we are running this list for a second time in recent months. We view management's ability to raise guidance as a catalyst for market-beating returns in the quarters ahead, and note that raising guidance during uncertain economic times, when vision is murky, is especially difficult. The following is a partial list of companies in the Argus Fundamental Universe of Coverage at which management increased its outlook during the recent reporting season. The notable sector imbalance in our list is partially due to when sectors report in the earnings cycle. For example, Financials report early and, as such, were heavily represented in the first list we produced in late October. "Management Signals" is one of our Investment Themes as we close out 2025, and we continue to like this theme as it crosses numerous industries and generates a robust list of potential portfolio candidates. Related tickers mentioned: APTV, CAH, CVS, DRI, EXPE, FDX, GD, JBL, KDP, MCHP, MCHPP, MDT, MRNA, PH, PLTR, RCL, RTX, TPR, UNH.
